thread.title: Charlotte-Area High School Football Players of the Week
thread.title_full: Charlotte-Area High School Football Players of the Week

author:
Langston Wertz Jr. 
lwertz @charlotteobserver.com
title: Charlotte-Area High School Football Players of the Week
text:
Charlotte-Area High School Football Players of the Week 
Charlotte-area’s football players of the week. Jeff Sochko Special to the Herald i Order Reprint of this Story 
Trajan Stephens-McQueen, West Mecklenburg: 14 tackles, including a key hit on South Meck’s final drive, in a 20-7 upset of South Mecklenburg. McQueen, a 6-2, 220-pound junior linebacker, is taking an unofficial visit to North Carolina this weekend. 
Cole Martin, Fort Mill Nation Ford (S.C.): Completed 23-of-34 passes for 395 yards and five touchdowns in a 49-27 win over Fort Mill. Fort Mill QB Rogan Wells was 31-of-50 for 337 yards and two touchdowns, plus 19 rushes for 46 yards and two more scores. 
Zaccheus Rorie, Forest Hills: Senior QB was 14-of-22 passing for 200 yards and three scores in a 41-34 come-from-behind win over Mount Pleasant. He ran for 152 yards and three scores. 
Drake Deluliis, Providence: 22 carries for 182 yards and a score against Berry Friday. He also threw a 46-yard scoring pass to Blake Proehl. 
Chazz Surratt, East Lincoln: Completed 22-of-29 passes for 377 yards and four touchdowns. He ran five times for 72 yards and two more scores. 
John Schweitzer, Gabe Montgomery, Providence Day: Schweitzer rushed 15 times for 192 yards and a score and was 9-of-18 passing for 75 yards in last week’s upset win over Charlotte Latin. Montgomery ran 21 times for 178 yards and four touchdowns. Related content
